snippet: The company played the lead role in halting an effort to have global retailers pay more for apparel to help Bangladesh factories improve their electrical and fire safety, officials also said.
abstract: Documents found at Tazreen Fashions factory in Bangladesh, where 112 worker died in fire, indicate that three American garment companies in 2012 were using factory to supply goods to Walmart; officials who attended meeting held in country in 2011 to discuss factory safety say that Walmart official played lead role in blocking effort to have global retailers pay more for apparel to help factories improve their electrical and fire safety.
lead_paragraph: The company played the lead role in halting an effort to have global retailers pay more for apparel to help Bangladesh factories improve their electrical and fire safety, officials also said.

headline.seo: 3 Walmart Suppliers Made Goods in Bangladesh Factory
headline.main: Documents Indicate Walmart Blocked Safety Push in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Documents Indicate Walmart Blocked Safety Push in Bangladesh
